name: Olympic Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And in the main lives up to first impressions.
reviews.title: Looking good.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious, the beds exceptionally comfortable and great bed linens.
reviews.title: Met our expectations for touring Olympic National Park.

reviews.text: If you are a light sleeper it is probably best to forgo the sea view - and the busy road-and ask for a room in the back.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel near Olympic National Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Still slight problems with the front desk in that 6 or 7 were waiting to check in and although there were 5 uniformed staff behind the desk at one point, only 2 were actually checking in guests.
reviews.title: Our getaway!

reviews.text: If I were to be very picky I would wish for a little more water pressure in the shower.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel to use as home base for Olympic peninsula exploring

reviews.text: Good location for a home base for exploring the National Park. Rooms were large and well decorated. Beds and pillows comfortable. Loved the comfy furniture and fireplace in the lobby. We sat in front of the roaring wood fire with our group of 6 and shared a bottle of wine. The front desk even had a cork screw for us when we discovered we has not packed one. The staff was very friendly and helpful in recommending places to eat and sights to see. Be sure to eat at The Cafe Garden! Best meal of our whole trip for a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Wish our stay was for more than one night.

reviews.text: My parents ate breakfast in the hotel and were very happy with the quality and portion. As far as we could see this is the best place to stay in Port Angeles.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: Everything about this place was excellent, including the price. It has a gorgeous lobby with a nice pool off to the side. Staff were very friendly and informative about the local area, especially the man on crutches. We opted for the golf course view side and we were on the ground floor which gave us a nice patio to watch the golfers. The room was quiet, clean and the bed was very nice.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 3 nights. The room was excellent. It was clean, clean, clean. The room was straightened up each day while we were out. Fresh towels provided daily. Our room was over the pool and I thought it would be a problem but it was closed at reasonable hour and it was no big deal at all. Staff was extremely helpful, courteous and friendly. Great place to stay and drive to nearby sites.
reviews.title: Just as nice as their photos

reviews.text: The lobby was very inviting to sit and reflect on day's adventures with friends. The only thing that would have made it better would have been to have coffee available for guests in the lobby.
reviews.title: Going to PA? Stay here!

reviews.text: We loved this hotel! Glad we checked the tripadvisor reviews before booking. The rooms were exceptionally clean and although we stayed in their most basic room (two queen beds), it was very spacious and well appointed. Loved that it had a microwave and small fridge discreetly tucked into the TV stand. Possibly the most comfortable bed I have slept in at any hotel, with high-quality sheets. During our short stay--passing through on our way from SEATAC to catch the ferry to Victoria--we were super impressed with the friendliness of the staff here. We will definitely stay here again and hope to make it a longer visit because it sounds like there are some interesting sights to see nearby.
reviews.title: Great hotel close to the Port Angeles ferry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only needed to stay one night as we made our way along Hwy 101 around the Penninsula. Most of the B&Bs in the area have a two night min policy and can be pretty pricey. The Olympic Lodge is right off the highway (easy to find and access), reasonably priced, clean, and comfortable. Breakfast is not included, but we ate at their restaurant and the food/service was great. We will stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a nice central location to base their stay.
reviews.title: Great Location and Accomidation

reviews.text: This neat little hotel is the perfect place for some r&r after exploring Olympic park. Great pool and hot tub. If you're ever in port Angeles, stop here and visit ONP. Also, if you are only stopping for a night just visit hurricane ridge in ONP. It is truly worth the very short drive.
reviews.title: Excellent Base Camp

reviews.text: This was not the first time we have stayed at the Olympic Lodge and it definitely will not be the last.We were lucky to have picture perfect weather during our short stay. This allowed us to take full advantage of their heated outdoor pool and hot tub. My husband enjoyed reading in the comfortable area around the pool. It was uncrowded and the pool temperatures were perfect. Our King Room on the third floor faced the hillside golf course. Our spacious room was very comfortable and immaculate. I liked the crisp sheets. Check in and check out were smooth. We know the area so we did not spend much time at the front desk. The young gentleman who checked us in was obviously new but charming as he went through a mental checklist. I purchased a local newspaper and enjoyed reading it in the welcoming lobby next to an enormous wood fire. There were large windows that highlighted the beautiful landscaping and a water feature just off the lobby. I think it is the nicest lodging in the area. I did not know they had a restaurant until this visit and I loved their view but the food and service did not measure up to the high standard set by the hotel. We found the area crowded due to holidays in Canada so all rooms in the area were going for full price. We used AAA to bring it in line with the other local lodgings. Many tourists stay on their way to and from Canada since the Black Ball car ferry is nearby. The highway leads to the Olympic National Park and the north coast. There are no other lodgings of this quality in this area.
reviews.title: Beautiful Setting, A Class Act

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed May 11 and 12 in a King room with a view. The bed and room were extremely comfortable and much enjoyed after not so comfortable stays at other locations on our trip around the park. The staff was extremely helpful in choosing great restaurants and we were always greeted with smiles and hellos as we walked through the lobby.
reviews.title: Very Comfy after a long trip to the ONP

reviews.text: If you want Hyatt Regency with a Starbucks and Ruths Chris in the lobby, then this place is not for you.
reviews.title: Great place, great price!
ok hotel
reviews.text: If you want a great, clean, comfortable hotel at an excellent price,with excellent staff and service, then this hotel is the place to be.

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: The hotel looks out over a hill-side golf course - a beautiful view seen from the lobby, the pool, the hot tub, and half of the hotel rooms. The lobby has a wood-burning fire place, which was burning the whole time I was there (3 days) - added a nice ambiance. Great lobby with several "conversation areas" with chairs and couches. Two more sitting areas on the balcony overlooking the lobby offered more privacy if needed. The outdoor pool and hot tub were quiet, clean, and offered a view of the golf course. My room was large, nice tv (needs a "sleep" feature), good beds, etc.
The staff were very helpful, offering suggestions on what to see and where to eat.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was not included in the room price. Breakfast was good quality and reasonably priced - much better than "continental" buffets in hotels of similar price.
reviews.title: A Gem in Port Angeles

description: Come visit Port Angeles’ Premier Hotel, the Olympic Lodge! Located on the Olympic Peninsula in Washington State, the Olympic Lodge offers the finest accommodations in a location that’s difficult to beat. Backed by the Olympic Mountains with the Strait of Juan de Fuca in the foreground, a variety of adventures are all close at hand. ▪ Choose from our 105 spacious rooms ▪ We have meeting space for any occasion: business meetings, retreats, receptions, family gatherings ▪ Relax by our heated pool and hot tub, open year round ▪ Play golf at the course adjacent to the hotel ▪ Join us for a scrumptious breakfast ▪ Enjoy the personalized service and hospitality offered by our experienced staff!
